{include "affiliate_loader"} Our partners are collecting critical data in the fight for our rights. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

It's been a long week, and we know there are a lot of questions about what the leaked draft SCOTUS decision means and how we will continue our fight in the weeks and months ahead. But, take heart in knowing that abortion is our right – and we won't stop fighting alongside Arkansas providers and partners to protect it.

Attacks on reproductive freedom target people and families who are already some of our most vulnerable Arkansans. If the Supreme Court issues a majority opinion that follows the leaked draft, it would deprive half the nation of a fundamental, constitutional right.

We know that Arkansans are already facing challenges to reproductive freedom that disproportionately push care out of reach for people of color, immigrants, people who live in rural areas, and people with low incomes.

That's why, right now, we are asking you to support our great partners like the Arkansas Abortion Support Network and Arkansas Coalition for Reproductive Justice, who have continued to support reproductive rights for thousands of Arkansans.

Abortion is legal in Arkansas – just as it is in all 50 states – and we will continue to fight to keep it that way. Thank you for helping us ensure that care is and remains accessible.

In solidarity,

Thank you,

{signature = 'ed'} {include "affiliate_signatures"}
